oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of the True Believers in Jesus' Name service, 1997 September 27
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opening with a view of the church form outside. The film zooms on to the sign before sweeping back to the small church. Several members set up as the video records the church from multiple angles. Shade Miller is the pastor and he begins the ceremony with a brief overview of the last service and testimony. He asks for other members to submit prayer requests and calls for prayer. Music follows the prayer and several women in the congregation including Gail Miller, Doris Lemming, Ethel Miller, and Delphia Nietzel. Billy Lemming plays guitar as he sings. Members stand up and dance as he plays and when Lemming finishes his song, he testifies before the congregation and talks about drinking strychnine. Billy Lemming’s testimony is followed by Ralph W. Hood and other members of the congregation giving testimony of their own. Shade Miller, who preaches again and talks about the religious aspects of serpent handling. Billy Lemming stands up at the altar once again and testifies a second time. When he is through, members come forward to the altar to pray. Shade Miller testifies one last time and dismisses the congregation with a last prayer.
